Name: bromoxynil production | bromoxynil | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: Bromoxynil is produced in four steps from phenol:;C6H6O + CHCl3 + KOH --> C7H6O2 + 2 HCl + KCl;C7H6O2 + 2 Br2 --> C7H4Br2O2 + HBr;C7H4Br2O2 + NH3O --> C7H5Br2NO2 + H2O ;C7H5Br2NO2 --> C7H2Br2NO + H2O;Precursors that are used for the bromoxynil production are hydroxylamine ((NH3OH)2SO4) and nitrous dioxide (NO2).;The formed hydrochloric acid is neutralised with sodium hydroxide and release to water as sodium, chloride and water.;Reference(s):;Unger T., (1996). Pesticide Synthesis Handbook, Noyes Publication.;Appleby A.P., Muller F., Carpy, S., (2011): Weed Control, in Ullmanns Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Weinheim, Wiley-VCH.
